Key Match Events: LeBron James scored 30 points and eight assists, putting the game away
Anthony Davis collected an 18 point and 18 rebound double-double
Jalen Johnson scored 19 points on 8-13 shooting
Onyeka Okongwu had a double-double with 14 points and 11 rebounds
Dyson Daniels racked up three turnovers by forcing two steals and foul on LeBron
LeBron hit a deep three to restore the Lakers lead to 11
Jalen Johnson hit a layup with 7:45 left in the quarter to make it an eight-point game at 72-80
Pre-Game Insights: The Hawks got both Bogdan Bogdanovic and Jalen Johnson back against the Lakers
The Lakers started Austin Reaves, Max Christie, LeBron James, Rui Hachimura and Anthony Davis
Coach Steve Kerr emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense
Post-Match Reflections: The Hawks' defense was especially poor in the 2nd quarter as they allowed the Lakers to rack up fouls and keep Atlanta at arm's length
The Hawks' defensive struggles is the bigger issue, they looked disorganized in help defense and on the perimeter, frequently giving up cutters to the rim and not being able to close out on shooters
This trend needs to stop if the Hawks are going to mount a serious run into the Eastern Conference playoffs
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hawks played a poor game on both ends of the court and paid dearly for it by losing to the Lakers despite getting multiple key pieces back
The Lakers took command of the game early, making it a 22-15 game with 3 minutes left in the first quarter
The Hawks' three-point shooting and losing the FT battle were the real story of Atlanta's deficit
The Hawks shot 46% from the field and 27% from three, while the Lakers shot 51% from the field and 38% from three
DeAndre Hunter scored 3 points on 1-12 shooting from the field and 0-6 shooting from deep
The Hawks will have a chance to get back on track against the Clippers tomorrow night at 10:30 pm EST
